text: is a Japanese footballer who plays for JEF United Chiba as a right full-back. He has played for the Japanese national team. ==Biography== Yonekura was born in Chiba on May 17, 1988. After graduating from Yachiyo High School, he joined J1 League club JEF United Chiba in 2007. JEF was relegated to J2 League for the first time in the club history at the end of the 2009 season. From 2011, he played many matches as a defensive midfielder. In 2013, he was converted to right-side back. In 2014, he moved to J1 club Gamba Osaka. In 2014, Gamba won all three major titles in Japan; J1 League, J.League Cup and Emperor's Cup. Gamba also won the 2015 Emperor's Cup. In July 2019, Yonekura moved back to his first club JEF United Chiba. In July 2015, Yonekura was selected the Japan national team for 2015 East Asian Cup. At this tournament, he debuted against China on August 9. He played two games for Japan in 2015. ==Statistics== ===Club career statistics=== Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Continental Continental Other1 Other1 Total Total Club Season League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup League Cup League Cup Asia Asia Total Total 2008 JEF United J1 8 0 0 0 3 1 – – 11 1 2009 16 0 3 2 4 0 – – 23 2 2010 J2 12 5 1 0 – – – 13 5 2011 35 7 3 1 – – – 38 8 2012 24 3 4 0 – – – 28 3 2013 41 6 1 0 – – – 42 7 Total Total Total 166 21 12 3 7 1 – – 185 25 2014 Gamba Osaka J1 21 1 4 0 9 2 – – 34 3 2015 31 2 4 0 1 0 10 2 3 0 49 4 2016 21 1 0 0 5 0 5 0 0 0 31 1 2017 13 0 1 0 4 0 1 0 – 19 0 2018 26 1 0 0 6 0 - - 32 1 2019 0 0 0 0 0 0 - - 0 0 Total Total Total 112 5 9 0 25 2 16 2 3 0 165 9 Career Total Career Total Career Total 278 26 21 3 32 3 16 2 3 0 350 34 1 includes J.
